text.front:
DOI: 10.1002/zaac.200700503
Two-Dimensional Monovalent Copper Halide Coordination Polymers
Incorporating Anti-Conformation 3,3Ј-Bipyridine
Lindsey L. Johnston a , Andrew J. Ursini a , Nathan P. Oien a , Matthew P. Desciak b , Randy S. Rarig, Jr. c ,
Jon Zubieta c , and Robert L. LaDuca a, *
a East Lansing MI / USA, Michigan State University, Lyman Briggs College and Department of Chemistry
b Wilkes-Barre, PA / USA, King's College, Department of Chemistry and Physics
c Syracuse, NY / USA, Syracuse University, Department of Chemistry
Received November 6 th , 2007.
Abstract.
Hydrothermal treatment of aqueous mixtures of cop-
per(II) halides and 3,3Ј-bipyridine (3,3Ј-bpy) has afforded the coor-
dination polymers [CuCl(3,3Ј-bpy)] n (1) and [Cu 2 Br 2 (3,3Ј-bpy)] n
(2), which were analyzed via single crystal X-ray diffraction, infra-
red spectroscopy, and elemental analysis. The structure of 1 consists
of two-dimensional (2-D) layers constructed from the linkage of
castellated one-dimensional (1-D) [CuCl] n stepped chains through
anti-conformation 3,3Ј-bpy tethers. Compound 2 presents a related
* Prof. Robert L. LaDuca
Lyman Briggs College and Department of Chemistry
Michigan State University
East Lansing MI 48825 / USA
E-mail: laduca@msu.edu
Z. Anorg. Allg. Chem. 2008, 634, 887Ϫ891
© 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim 887
2-D sheet motif, albeit built from infinite 1-D [Cu 2 Br 2 ] n ladders
strutted by 3,3Ј-bpy ligands in anti conformation. In both cases
neighboring 2-D sheets stack into 3-D via weak CϪH•••halogen
interactions.
Keywords: Hydrothermal synthesis; Copper; Halides; Coordination
polymer; Bipyridine; Supramolecular interactions
Scheme 1 Conformations of 3,3Ј-bpy.
